intro: Meum venosum, commonly known as the veiny meum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely veined leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Meum venosum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
